alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 5:50PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following counties, Apache and Navajo. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Dirt roads will become muddy and potentially impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tees Toh Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, Oraibi Wash, Bidahochi Wash, Steamboat Wash, Polacca Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Wepo Wash, Coyote Wash, Jeddito Wash, Sabito Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash and Big Dam Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indian Wells, Greasewood Springs, Cedar Springs, Tees Toh, Sunrise Springs, Seba Dalkai, Cornfields Chapter House, Greasewood, Navajo Reservation and Hopi Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 87 between mile markers 382 and 406. State Route 264 between mile markers 384 and 388. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
